title.value: Mitigating Translationese in Low-resource Languages: The Storyboard Approach
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document, identifying the focus on mitigating translationese using the storyboard approach.
title.quote: Mitigating Translationese in Low-resource Languages: The Storyboard Approach

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of storyboards to collect language data for low-resource languages, aiming to mitigate the translationese effect by eliciting natural and fluent sentences from native speakers. The study compares this method with traditional translation-based approaches for languages like Hausa, Ibibio, Swahili, and Yorùbá.

type.justification: The research involves a comprehensive evaluation comparing the storyboard-based approach with traditional methods using human evaluation and quantitative metrics, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: We conducted a comprehensive evaluation comparing our storyboard-based approach with traditional text translation-based methods in terms of accuracy and fluency.

name.justification: The research focuses on language data collection, translation quality, and mitigating translationese, which are key areas within Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Low-resource languages pose significant challenges when it comes to acquiring high-quality language data for various applications, including language documentation, linguistic research, and machine translation.

name.justification: The paper addresses issues related to machine translation, specifically the quality of translations in low-resource languages and translationese effects.
name.quote: Translationese has been widely recognized for its detrimental impact not only on machine translation tasks but also on other tasks involving crosslingual transfer learning.

name.justification: The research explores the impact of translationese on cross-lingual transfer learning and aims to create better training data for such tasks.
name.quote: Translationese has been widely recognized for its detrimental impact not only on machine translation tasks but also on other tasks involving cross-lingual transfer learning.

name.justification: The dataset is described as part of the research, used for collecting images and corresponding English sentences for the storyboard approach.
name.quote: We obtain our dataset from the Totem Field Storyboards, which provides a collection of storyboards consisting of sequential visual representations of stories in specific contexts, accompanied by corresponding English sentences describing the depicted scenes.
